title: Ticket #3375: Increase flocking by more than one site at a time
description: Idea at this point is to add two knobs: FLOCK_INIT and FLOCK_INC. Flock level will be initialized to FLOCK_INIT, then increase by FLOCK_INC on each cycle. Flocking will then decrease by decrement of 1 until reaching FLOCK_INIT. Sorry if my description here is vague; I will be learning this code as I work on this.
remarks:
2012-Dec-12 12:47:48 by ziliang:
I thought flocking levels went up as we failed to find matches?

2012-Dec-12 12:55:20 by nwp:
It does. The point is to give admins the option to make the flock level go up faster, or start at a higher level, than the hard-coded default.

2012-Dec-12 13:07:36 by bbockelm:
An alternate approach would be to allow the admin to specify the flocking level of the remote collector. This would allow for more careful control.

Another approach would be to flock at the collector level (attempting all collectors listed in a collector).

2013-Jan-15 16:38:22 by nwp:
I need a reviewer for this.

2013-Jan-15 17:08:54 by bbockelm:
Is there a design document for this work? Do you have any benchmarks showing this is a problem?

2013-Jan-15 21:28:51 by nwp:
Its not a problem. It is a new feature requested by CHTC.

2013-Jan-28 14:51:14 by nwp:
OK, this works. Now need to write a retroactive design doc:

2013-Apr-15 14:45:14 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW of commit [34853]

This seems like a large patch, with a lot of refactored code which is not clear needed to be refactored.

It is not clear to me why this patch could not literally be a three-liner, e.g in count_jobs() replace the line 

Owners[i].​FlockLevel++;​

with 

Owners[i].​FlockLevel += param_integer("FLOCK_INCREMENT",1,1);
if (Owners[i].​FlockLevel > MaxFlockLevel) {
   Owners[i].​FlockLevel = MaxFlockLevel;
}

Why would the above not work?

2013-Apr-15 15:34:01 by nwp:
That needs to be done in at two different places. So it is at least a 6 line patch.

2013-Apr-15 16:35:41 by nwp:
I created a minimal patch, and attached it to this ticket. Is this what you are looking for?

2013-Apr-17 11:20:52 by tannenba:
Yes! The minimal attached patch looks good, please commit in place of the larger patch (but keeping the dprintf statements the same so the regression test of this work still operates - speaking of which, these statements could perhaps be dprintf D_ALWAYS | D_DEBUG).
